head.citation-title: Heat exchanger network retrofit by pinch design method using stage-model mathematical programming
head.abstracts: The energy and capital costs of a heat exchanger network are both dependent on the pinch temperature, which is set as target prior to the design of a heat exchanger network (HEN). A retrofit potential program was developed using visual basic for application to find the optimum pinch temperature in targeting step. The program can automatically generate composite curves, and grand composite curve of the process hot and cold streams. The HEN of crude preheat train from the Bagajewicz (2010) paper is used to illustrate this procedure. This is an abstract of a paper presented at the CHISA 2012 - 20th International Congress of Chemical and Process Engineering and PRES 2012 - 15th Conference PRES (Prague, Czech Republic 8/25-29/2012).

ref-title.ref-titletext: All-at-once and step-wise detailed retrofit of heat exchanger networks using an MILP model
